1.text: Apply a thin layer of lip balm to moisturize and even out your lips.

2.text: Trace your lips with a lip pencil to prevent bleeding if you like.

3.text: Smile so your application will be even.

4.text: Start applying lipstick in the center of your lips.

5.text: Drag the lipstick from the center to the corner of your mouth.

6.text: Use your finger to fill in patchy areas with a second layer.

7.text: Blot the inside of your lips with a tissue to remove excess.

8.text: Prime your lips with foundation before applying lipstick for an easy option.

9.text: Apply a makeup primer to your lips as another option.

10.text: Dust setting powder over your lipstick to prevent smudging.

11.text: Dab a lighter shade over darker lipstick to make your lips look plumper.

12.text: Create ombre lips using 2 shades of the same color.

13.text: Dab powder blush over your lipstick to make it look matte.

14.text: Pick shades with blue or purple undertones for a cool complexion.

15.text: Look for orange or yellow undertones if you have a warm complexion.

16.text: Play around with different shades if you have neutral undertones.

17.text: Skip red or dark lipsticks if you have thin lips.

18.text: Avoid glossy or glittery lipstick if you have plump lips.

19.text: Apply a lighter shade to your bottom lip if your top lip is bigger.

20.text: Dab nude lipstick under your Cupid’s bow to balance a plump bottom lip.
